TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caitra Tribute[COLOR_REVERT] (the Majapahit replacement for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT]) provides a free Merchant.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]hommage à Caitra[COLOR_REVERT] (équivalent majapahit du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]tribunal[COLOR_REVERT]) procure un marchand gratuit.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caitra Tribute[COLOR_REVERT] (the Majapahit replacement for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT]) provides a free Merchant.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caitra Tribute[COLOR_REVERT] (the Majapahit replacement for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT]) provides a free Merchant.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caitra Tribute[COLOR_REVERT] (the Majapahit replacement for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT]) provides a free Merchant.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The main event of the Majapahit administrative calendar took place on the first day of the month of Caitra (March-April) when representatives from all territories paying tax or tribute to Majapahit came to the capital to pay court. Majapahit's territories were roughly divided into three types: the palace and its vicinity; the areas of east Java and Bali which were directly administrated by officials appointed by the king; and the outer dependencies which enjoyed substantial internal autonomy.
